content:
Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 1 of 30.


Your forces:
- Your carrier AC1: position (5, 1), stationary, HP 100/100, speed 2, vision 4.
- Your squadron ASQ1: on board a carrier, ready to launch., HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.
- Your squadron ASQ2: on board a carrier, ready to launch., HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 1: My carrier is at (5,1) and the enemy carrier is expected near (26,26). My primary objective is to find the enemy carrier as early as possible to gain a decisive advantage. I will launch both squadrons to scout forward towards the enemy's expected position, covering a wide area. Concurrently, I will move my carrier south-east to reduce the distance for subsequent, deeper scouting operations and to position it more centrally on the map, away from the top-left landmass. Squadron launch targets (20,15) and (15,20) are chosen to cover a significant portion of the approach paths towards the enemy's known starting quadrant, within their operational range of 22 hexes from my current carrier position.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 15, "y": 10}, "launch_target": {"x": 20, "y": 15}}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 2 of 30.

Recent events:
- your squadron(ASQ1) set a new target toward position (20, 15) while at (7, 4).

Your forces:
- Your carrier AC1: position (6, 3), en route to target (15, 10), HP 100/100, speed 2, vision 4.
- Your squadron ASQ1: position (7, 4), outbound toward (20, 15), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.
- Your squadron ASQ2: on board a carrier, ready to launch., HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 2: My carrier is progressing towards the center of the map. My squadron ASQ1 is en route to its scouting target. I failed to launch ASQ2 last turn, which is a critical oversight for early detection. I will correct this by launching ASQ2 immediately towards (15,20), to complement ASQ1's path and expand our scouting coverage towards the enemy's expected position in the south-east quadrant. The carrier will continue its movement as planned.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 15, "y": 10}, "launch_target": {"x": 15, "y": 20}}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 3 of 30.

Recent events:
- your squadron(ASQ2) set a new target toward position (15, 20) while at (8, 6).

- Your squadron ASQ1: position (9, 7), outbound toward (20, 15), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.
- Your squadron ASQ2: position (8, 6), outbound toward (15, 20), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 3: My carrier AC1 continues its movement towards the target (15,10) to improve its central map position and facilitate deeper scouting later. Both squadrons, ASQ1 and ASQ2, are actively flying towards their respective scouting targets (20,15) and (15,20) in the suspected enemy territory. There are no new events or enemy sightings this turn. The current strategy for early detection is progressing as planned. I will continue to monitor their progress and await scouting reports to update my tactical decisions.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 15, "y": 10}, "launch_target": null}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 4 of 30.


Your forces:

- Your squadron ASQ2: position (10, 10), outbound toward (15, 20), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 4: My carrier AC1 is continuing its movement towards the more central map position (15,10) as planned, which will improve the range for future squadron launches. Both ASQ1 and ASQ2 are proceeding on their outbound scouting paths towards (20,15) and (15,20) respectively, covering the likely approach lanes to the enemy's expected starting area. There have been no enemy sightings yet, which is not unexpected at this early stage. I will maintain the current orders for both the carrier and the squadrons as the strategy for early enemy detection is still in execution.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 15, "y": 10}, "launch_target": null}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 5 of 30.

Recent events:
- your squadron(ASQ2) spotted an enemy squadron(BSQ1) at (9, 14) while at (12, 14).
- your squadron(ASQ2) spotted an enemy squadron(BSQ2) at (11, 16) while at (12, 14).

Enemy intelligence:
- Enemy carrier position unknown.
- Enemy squadron BSQ1: last known position (9, 14) (previously at (10, 16)), HP 40/40.
- Enemy squadron BSQ2: last known position (11, 16) (previously at (11, 17)), HP 40/40.

Your forces:
- Your carrier AC1: position (10, 7), en route to target (15, 10), HP 100/100, speed 2, vision 4.
- Your squadron ASQ1: position (15, 11), outbound toward (20, 15), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.
- Your squadron ASQ2: position (12, 14), outbound toward (15, 20), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 5: My squadron ASQ2 has spotted two enemy squadrons, BSQ1 and BSQ2, in the area of (9,14) and (11,16) respectively. This is a critical development as it strongly indicates the enemy carrier's general location. The enemy squadrons' past movement from (10,16) and (11,17) towards NW suggests their carrier is located to their south-east. I estimate the enemy carrier to be in the vicinity of (20,20), or further south-east from the current enemy squadron positions. My immediate priority is to locate and attack the enemy carrier. I will redirect both ASQ1 and ASQ2 towards this estimated enemy carrier position at (20,20) to concentrate their search and attack efforts. My carrier AC1, currently at (10,7), will continue moving south-east towards (15,12) to close the distance to the potential enemy carrier area, ensuring better range for subsequent squadron launches and keeping a safe distance from the sighted enemy squadrons to avoid detection. This coordinated strike/reconnaissance aims to achieve an decisive early hit on the enemy carrier.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 15, "y": 12}, "launch_target": {"x": 20, "y": 20}}}

ERROR: invalid your order, rejected: launch_target was rejected. Currently, all air squadrons are deployed on missions, and there are no squadrons aboard the carrier. Orders cannot be issued to squadrons that are already deployed.
Please fix your order.

{"thinking": "Turn 5: My squadron ASQ2 has indeed spotted two enemy squadrons, BSQ1 and BSQ2, providing crucial intelligence on the enemy's general location. My previous command to 'launch_target' was incorrect as both ASQ1 and ASQ2 are already deployed. I apologize for this oversight. ASQ1 is heading towards (20,15) and ASQ2 towards (15,20), which are still effective scouting paths towards the likely enemy carrier area (estimated around 20,20 or further south-east based on enemy squadron sightings). My carrier AC1 will continue its planned movement towards (15,12) to close the distance to the battle area, ensuring a better position for future squadron operations (re-launching if they return, or launching new ones if available) and maintaining a safe distance from the sighted enemy squadrons. The current mission of ASQ1 and ASQ2 to locate the enemy carrier remains paramount.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 15, "y": 12}, "launch_target": null}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 6 of 30.

- Enemy squadron BSQ2: last known position (10, 12) (previously at (11, 17)), HP 40/40.

- Your squadron ASQ2: position (14, 18), outbound toward (15, 19), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 6: We have made a critical breakthrough! My squadron ASQ2 has located the enemy carrier BC1 at (15,19), and it has automatically initiated an attack. This is a decisive advantage. Furthermore, my carrier AC1 has also spotted enemy squadrons BSQ1 and BSQ2 at (9,10) and (10,12) respectively, indicating they are in my carrier's immediate vicinity. This puts AC1 at significant risk. Given that my squadrons cannot be redirected once launched, ASQ2 will continue its attack on BC1. ASQ1 is currently heading to (20,15); its path is still good as it will likely intercept and attack BC1 due to its proximity (approx 6.7 hexes from BC1, within its vision range of 5). The most urgent task now is to ensure the survival of my carrier. My current carrier target (15,12) is too close to the enemy carrier and the enemy squadrons. I must immediately move AC1 to a safer position, away from the detected enemy units, preferably towards the North-West, to avoid incoming attacks and reposition for potential future launches or evasive maneuvers. Therefore, I will set AC1's target to (5,5) which is a safe sea area away from the current threat.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 5, "y": 5}, "launch_target": null}}

{"thinking": "Turn 7: My squadron ASQ2 has successfully located and engaged the enemy carrier BC1 at (15,19). This is a critical development and a major step towards victory. However, enemy squadrons BSQ1 and BSQ2 have been spotted perilously close to my carrier AC1 at (10,9) and (10,8) respectively, indicating my carrier is in immediate danger. My carrier AC1 is currently moving towards (5,5) for evasion, which is the correct immediate action to minimize risk. My other squadron, ASQ1, is unfortunately returning to my carrier from (20,15). As I cannot redirect it mid-flight, it must complete its return. Once ASQ1 is back on board, I will immediately relaunch it towards the confirmed enemy carrier position at (15,19) to support ASQ2's attack and apply maximum pressure on BC1. For now, the priority is carrier safety and continuing the attack with ASQ2.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 5, "y": 5}, "launch_target": null}}

My carrier is still moving towards the safe coordinates (5,5) for evasion, which is crucial for its survival. Both ASQ1 and ASQ2 are now returning to my carrier, with ASQ2 also damaged (HP 20/40). I cannot issue new orders to them until they are safely back on board. My primary strategy remains to sink the enemy carrier. Once my squadrons are available, they will be immediately relaunched to continue the attack on BC1.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 5, "y": 5}, "launch_target": null}}

ASQ2 successfully engaged the enemy carrier BC1, dealing damage and reducing its HP to 80. The enemy carrier's position at (15,19) is confirmed. My current priority is to ensure AC1's survival while preparing for a decisive follow-up attack. Once ASQ1 and ASQ2 are back on board, I will immediately relaunch them, with ASQ1 leading the charge due to ASQ2's current damage, to finish off BC1. My primary objective remains to sink the enemy carrier. {"thinking": "Turn 15: My carrier AC1 remains at a safe position (5,5) with 48 HP. My squadrons ASQ1 and ASQ2 are both en route to the enemy carrier's last known position at (15,19). Although the enemy carrier's position is now reported as 'unknown', it was last damaged and confirmed at (15,19) in Turn 12. It is highly probable that it has moved from this position. However, my squadrons are already committed to their current flight path and cannot be redirected. Their current targets are reasonable starting points for a search in the general area where the enemy carrier was last seen and where enemy squadrons are still active. The sighting of enemy squadrons BSQ1 at (10,13) and BSQ2 at (12,17) suggests the enemy carrier might have moved towards the west or northwest from its last known position (15,19), or is attempting to hide behind the large landmass. I will keep my carrier stationary at (5,5) to maintain its safety. I cannot launch any new squadrons as none are onboard.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 5, "y": 5}, "launch_target": null}}
